strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: Sorry about before. I was convinced you were with Dhoulmagus, you see.
<se_high>*: I'm not at liberty to disclose the details, but we came here to the Dark Ruins in pursuit of Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>*: Dhoulmagus murdered Mr. Golding, you know. He stabbed him in the chest with a staff.
<se_high>*: But straight afterwards he put his hand on his own chest as if he was in pain himself. Though he didn't look to have so much as a scratch.
<se_high>*: It seemed like he wasn't in the best of health. I've no idea what's wrong with him, though. And I don't much care.
<se_def>*: Unbelievable! We were right on top of him until we got here. And now he's safe in there and we're standing around out here! Blast it all!

<se_def>*: Why would such a formidable assassin need to run away and hide?<page>*: I mean, Mr. Golding was a monster of a man! He wouldn't have gone down easily, so this Dhoulmagus must be a real devil.
<se_def>*: I'm prepared to die if I have to! If that's what it takes to avenge my master!
<se_def>*: The darkness inside is impenetrable. It's impossible to find your way. But if we could just dispel the dark aura, we might stand a chance.
<se_def>*: The Argonian royal family's magic mirror would do the trick, I'm sure.
<se_def>*: And Argonia's not too far from Baccarat. But still...
<se_def>*: There's not much point in us going. We don't have any connections in the royal family. It would be a waste of time.
<se_def>*: I realised we wouldn't achieve anything by just waiting around here, so I dispatched two of my men to Argonia.
<se_def>*: With a bit of luck, the King will agree to lend them the magic mirror.<page>*: It's a bit of a long shot, though. It is a royal heirloom, after all.
<se_def>*: What!? You think you can penetrate the dark aura?
<se_def>*: I've already told you, that's quite impossible without the magic mirror.
<se_def>*: Ohhhh! Ooooh! The aura of darkness is no more! The legacy of so many years, destroyed!
<se_def>*: This shrine was built in anticipation of the revival of our beloved leader, Rhapthorne.
<se_def>*: The aura of darkness was its protection from the evil heretics.
<se_def>*: The infidels have broken through the dark aura! They must be preparing to attack us...!
<se_def>*: This shrine was built in anticipation of the revival of our beloved leader, Rhapthorne.
<se_def>*: The aura of darkness was its protection from the evil heretics.
<se_def>*: The infidels have broken through the dark aura! They must be preparing to attack us...!
<se_def>*: Ohhhh! Ooooh! I felt it! For the first time in what seems like an eternity, I felt the power of Rhapthorne near me!
<se_def>*: But my lack of physical form prevents me from seeing the Lord of Darkness. Could it really have been him!? Could he have returned to us?
<se_def>*: Behold the mural, oh beings of flesh and blood!
<se_def>*: Behold the magnificent image of Lord Rhapthorne, locked in his titanic struggle to bring darkness to the world!
<se_def>*: Long ago, he created the World of Darkness, by filling the ground with the bodies of those who failed to obey him.
<se_high>*: Woooh! Woooh! Inside lies the holy altar of darkness. The dais built in honour of our great Lord.
<se_high>*: Only those who have struck the wings of Empyrea, the hateful bird depicted on the wall, are permitted to approach the Lord of Darkness.
<se_high>*: But we spirits have lost all physical substance. I cannot hope to move the demon statues. Oh, what a cruel fate!
<se_high>*: Thank you! Thank you! You have attacked the accursed bird Empyrea for me! Thank you!
<se_high>*: I can feel it! Lord Rhapthorne's resurrection is nigh! Lead us to the darkness, my Lord!
<se_def>*: Ohhhh! Ohhhh! I can feel it. The beat, the pulse, the throb of darkness.
<se_def>*: Lord Rhapthorne has returned at last! My eternal wait has ended!
<se_def>*: It is time! Time for we slaves of darkness to rally at his feet.
<se_def>*: If we had the Argonian royal family's magic mirror, we might be able to penetrate this dark aura somehow.
<se_def>*: But none of us have any royal connections. Even if we were to go to Argonia, the King would never agree to see us.
<se_def>*: Still, we have no choice but to try. I've been southeast from Baccarat before, and it is a long way to Argonia. But we must go.<page>*: I just hope it won't be a wasted journey.
<se_def>*: Seeing as you are in pursuit of that jester too, I suppose I can tell you.
<se_def>*: We are employed by Mr. Golding, the owner of the Baccarat casino.
<se_def>*: Or should I say, used to be employed? You see, Mr. Golding was murdered by the jester.
<se_def>*: We're under orders to avenge his death. That's why we're here.
<se_high>*: When we were chasing that jester here, I saw him clasp his chest in pain every now and then.
<se_high>*: Come to think of it, it seemed to start hurting him directly after he stabbed Mr. Golding with that staff of his.
<se_high>*: And I overheard him muttering something about needing a new body. Because his was too pitiful or something.
<se_high>*: I'm not sure what he meant exactly, but the way he said it sent a shiver down my spine.
<se_def>*: Ohhhh! Ooooh! It's vanished! The feeling was only ever slight, but now I can't feel Lord Rhapthorne's presence at all.
<se_def>*: Was it merely an illusion? A trick?
<se_high>*: Curse Empyrea! She is responsible for this! She has robbed us of all hope of darkness! I will never forgive her!
<se_high>*: Ohhhh! Ooooh! Curse Empyrea! Curse her foul kin! Curse her degenerate progeny for all eternity!
